messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] American History
messages.msgSnippet: Geronimo is one of our favorite movies!! So many were killed between the time of the first invaders and well - right up to NOW - during the Occupation - that I
messages.messageBody:
Geronimo is one of our favorite movies!!

So many were killed between the time of the first invaders and well - right up to NOW - during the Occupation - that I would be very, very surprised if there aren't many folks returning!
Janis
----- Original Message -----
From: starsuncloud@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, April 13, 2003 12:04 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] American History


In a message dated 4/12/03 3:20:38 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< We've been
>asked to give talks about American Indian history, however, it has to be
>from a Christian viewpoint - that the millions that died, the
>enslavements; the genocide was all worth it because the Europeans brought
>Jesus. >>

That is a huge hot point for me.
I often think that if I have lived former lives, one of them must have been
as an American Indian.....I am so drawn to their ways, their stories, it
feels like it's in my blood.
But I sure don't look the part in THIS life. :)

We watched Geronimo a couple nights ago, pretty powerful stuff.
I cried more than once. It was all so awful.
The guy that played the part of Goyatla was perfect...he exuded strength and
a warrior like presence!

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
